name: Aerodactyl
flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokemon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.
Ability1Text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Articuno
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokemon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Ditto
flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
Ability1Text: If Ditto is your Active Pokemon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokemon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokemon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokemon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Dragonite
flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokemon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gengar
flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokemon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokemon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Haunter
flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Hitmonlee
flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Hypno
flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
Attack1Text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Kabutops
flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Lapras
flavorText: A Pokemon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Attack1Text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

name: Moltres
flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.
Attack1Text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Muk
flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
Ability1Text: Ignore all Pokemon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
Attack1Text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokemon, do the damage to each of them.

name: Zapdos
flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokemon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.
Attack1Text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

name: Aerodactyl
flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokemon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.
Ability1Text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Articuno
flavorText: A legendary bird Pokemon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Ditto
flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
Ability1Text: If Ditto is your Active Pokemon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokemon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokemon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokemon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokemon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Hypno
flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
Attack1Text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Kabutops
flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Lapras
flavorText: A Pokemon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
Attack1Text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

name: Moltres
flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.
Attack1Text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Muk
flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
Ability1Text: Ignore all Pokemon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.
Attack1Text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokemon, do that damage to each of them.

name: Zapdos
flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokemon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.
Attack1Text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

name: Arbok
flavorText: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokemon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Cloyster
flavorText: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gastly
flavorText: A mysterious Pokemon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while other believe it is formed from smog.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

name: Golbat
flavorText: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Golduck
flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

name: Golem
flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

name: Graveler
flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Kingler
flavorText: The large pincer has 10,000 horsepower of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Kingler.

name: Magmar
flavorText: Found at the mouths of volcanoes and extremely hard to spot. There are very few instances of capturing this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Omastar
flavorText: A prehistoric Pokemon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Sandslash
flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Seadra
flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

name: Slowbro
flavorText: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left-over scraps.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokemon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Tentacruel
flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Weezing
flavorText: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Pokemon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Weezing does 60 damage to itself.

name: Ekans
flavorText: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds such as Pidgey and Spearow whole.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Geodude
flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Grimer
flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Horsea
flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Kabuto
flavorText: A Pokemon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.
Ability1Text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Krabby
flavorText: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon named Krabby and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench if full.)

name: Omanyte
flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
Ability1Text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Psyduck
flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokemon will use psychokinetic powers.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Shellder
flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shellder during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.
Attack2Text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Tentacool
flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
Ability1Text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Zubat
flavorText: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Remove a number of damage counters from Zubat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Zubat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.
